Class DebugShip

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.DebugShip
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DebugShip extends Command implements Serializable
The DebugShip class represents a specialized command in the game to debug and modify the player's ship setup. It extends the Command class and implements Serializable. The class is responsible for setting up specific debug configurations for a player's ship by inserting predefined tiles and adjustments for testing purposes. This command interacts with the player's PlayerBoard and uses specific tiles from a tile deck to construct a test configuration. The execute method carries out the modifications based on the `number` parameter which determines the specific debug use case. Tile rotations, placements, and adjustments are explicitly programmed for debugging purposes. Fields: - `commandType`: Specifies the type of command as "DebugShip". - `number`: Represents the debug scenario or configuration to be executed. Constructors: - DebugShip(String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token, int number): Initializes the command with the provided game ID, player ID, title, and debug configuration number. - DebugShip(): Default empty constructor. Methods: - execute(Player player): Overrides the execute method to perform the debugging setup on the player's ship. The method retrieves the player's PlayerBoard, validates the tiles, and sets up a predefined debug configuration based on the `number` provided.
See Also:

      public DebugShip(String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token, int number)
      Constructs a DebugShip object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player
      lv - the level associated with the DebugShip command
      title - the title or name associated with the DebugShip command

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(Player player) throws IOException
      Executes the specified action for the given player during the building phase of the game. This method customizes the player's board based on predefined configurations or setups, while ensuring the player adheres to the rules of this phase.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose game actions are being executed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output operation fails or is interrupted.
      InvalidInput - If the player's action violates predefined conditions, such as being in the wrong game level or attempting to debug more than once.
